review_title: Educational environment with competent market leaders
job_title: Horticulturist in Kirkwood, MO
pros: Best management practices are used on new and established plantings around campus. Great learning environment with support. Hard, satisfying work.
cons: Poor communication within the department hurts productivity

review_title: Good People, Good Student Body, Disconnected Leadership
job_title: Student Recruiter in Saint Louis, MO
pros: This is a great job if you are passionate about helping students and you want a good team around you.
cons: The biggest downside to this job is that the administrators are quite disconnected to the day to day work lower-level employees do, and they don't seem to make decisions based on what the students or employees need. The administrators like to only consult with each other.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Benefits & leave options are very good
cons: Low Salaries, no training, upper management are selfish & micromanage

job_title: Tutor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The tutoring center will schedule hours that fit around your classes It's a good chance to review material you have studied Sometimes you can do your own homework on the clock
cons: Some students are quite hostile and entitled No way to move up

job_title: Programmer/Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: STLCC is a great college to work for. I've enjoyed the 5ish years I've been working here and haven't felt a strong desire to search for a new job unlike past positions I've had. It's not overly stressful. The work you do is satisfying and feels useful/important to the overall success of the college. They're very supportive of training and making sure you're learning any new technologies that you feel would be helpful. In some ways you are your own boss when it comes to how you solve a programming problem.
cons: You don't get an opportunity to program in high level application development type languages or experiencing agile development lifecycles. Also with being your own boss in terms of how you program, this can be a downside as a lot of code between departments is inconsistent and not standardized. This is being improved every year though. Salary can be lower than other companies out there as well.

job_title: IT Help Desk in Wildwood, MO
pros: Excellent staff and management workers.
cons: Some of the teachers who called in were un professional.

job_title: Facilities Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great People and co workers
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Experience answering all types of questions and using skills learned in class. Great environment to learn
cons: Had students who just wanted the answer

job_title: SI Leader in Kirkwood, MO
pros: Easy work, considerate of student workers schedules

job_title: Auxiliary Operator Associate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I only worked at Forest Park Campus. The environment is kind chaotic; due extreme repairs on going. The people are friendly and courteous. I added my drive, character and sense of compassion understand the to all individuals. I can help accommodate. At time, sometimes students and staff  are less open to others'.  Archer reaches goals to make others stronger. As they  become greater. Some staff and student help each other outside school. I always be myself and eliminate negative professionalism. If it referred by costumer, student or staff member at STLCC.

review_title: Good Pay, and works around your schedule
job_title: Cashier in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Hourly pay for employees is decent, people that work at the college are friendly, see them out on weekend and say hi.   Working hours are good, no weekends or late evenings. College gives you some many credit hrs per semister to go to school, also get a discount at the bookstore.  Safety test every month, and quaterly we get a meal vocture to the cafteria.
cons: Not much room for advancement for hourly employees, don't always feel appreciated. People talk behind backs, can't say any thing negative to anyone or it will some back to you. Good for a job while going through school

review_title: Was a good place to work.
job_title: Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The experience of being a professor at STLCC is rewarding in terms of working with students and great colleagues.
cons: Chancellor Pittman is taking the college down the wrong path, replacing full time faculty with underpaid adjuncts. Pittman has spent his entire professional life in Indiana, and is unfamiliar with the supportive culture of St. Louis. The board blindly supports his desire to rob students of quality education. This month marked the beginning of the end of St. Louis community college as an institute of higher education, and is now on its way to becoming a technical college, just as the Chancellor ruined Ivy Tech in Indiana.

job_title: Associate Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The pros are the pros of any teaching position - the time in the classroom with students.  Nothing particular about this institution is a "pro".
cons: Embarrassing facilities, poorly run.  No support for programs.  Such poor organization and communication that nobody really knows what's going on.  Too much red tape to get anything done.   The negative relationship between administration and faculty is only getting worse.  College is moving toward more and more online classes and adjunct faculty, which does not improve the quality of education of the students.  It's purely an attempt to fill seats and save money.

review_title: I believe the College needs to be totally rebranded.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The 5 year vesting period to be eligible for the Public School Retirement System (PSRS) employee lifetime benefit. After completing the 5th year, employees have access to the money they have been forced to invest or may elect to have a lifetime retirement benefit.
cons: Only the faculty are privileged to a promotion schedule. The rest of the employees rarely received raises. There weren't any merit reviews and when raises were issued, the squatters received the same amount as the high performers.

review_title: In the experience I received at Saint Louis Community College, I found that communication was a key to understanding.
job_title: Clerical in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The best reason for working at STLCC-FP, was the knowledge I received in working with others and helping them understand what education that would nterest new students.
cons: The cons were the facts that I didn't get enough time to work with others and the fact that it was just a temporary position.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
excellent compensation and benefits
freedom to control class schedule
cons:
benefits sometimes change yearly
inconsistency in policy and procedure due to continuously changing leadership
conflict between corporate goals and published commitment to student learning

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Outstanding ESL Program Coordinator and support staff: forward thinking, dedicated to effective teaching practices, very supporting of teachers, and love of international students.  Students definitely succeed in learning academic English in this program.
cons: The pay could be better, although it has improved recently due to the pressure of teacher's union contract.  Job security is shaky due to to cutbacks in government funding for public education in Missouri, and to  fluctuating student admissions.

review_title: Overall a good place to work.
job_title: in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Teachers are well supported. Some very talented and caring people work there. Benefits and vacation days are generous. Most superiors were supportive and encouraged professional growth.
cons: I had a very positive experience working there. However, there could be improvement with their technology department. Slow to respond to users.

job_title: Director in Saint Louis, MO
pros: At the time they had good benefits, but that may have changed by now. Somewhat flexible environment.
cons: Political. The further you get into administration you see what a mess it is. Some excellent leaders and some that care more about numbers than actual workers or students.

review_title: A great place to work for/Some transitional anxiety
job_title: Associate Tutor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The best reason to work here is the opportunity to directly impact your community and individual lives for the better.
cons: STLCC is going through a series of transitions and restructure reflecting the decrease in enrollment. There is an air of uncertainty and anxiety about personal futures and viability.

job_title: Department Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great faculty and staff, mostly.  Pay and benefits are okay but not competitive.
cons: Central management is very anti-labor and anti-union.  Lots of employee unrest and low morale due to weak Board and poor central management.  Primary fiscal management tool is salary reduction for workers while central administrators get raises.

review_title: TRIO Program: Nice People, Bad Management
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kirkwood, MO
pros: The people are nice, the opportunities to help others is vast, learned some good skills about the workplace.
cons: The management was abysmal, there were times when you would be required to take work home to finish it on time, it never felt like there was any job security (the manager could fire you on a dime for the smallest inconvenience).

job_title: Clerk in Florissant, MO
pros: I worked on a great team, hours were great.  I enjoyed interacting with the students and learned a lot about the admissions process. My manager was great and co workers were very supportive.
cons: I worked on a part time basis for 10 years, always received good reviews, but was never able to get on full time.

review_title: Professional atmosphere and nice caring staff.
job_title: Program Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Company very customer focused and most staff want to do their best to help others.
cons: Hard to get into the hard money positions most positions contractual.

review_title: Steady job, steady work, easy day
job_title: Student Worker in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Going to school and working there means you'll get to know where all the rooms are in a few months, decent pay
cons: Nothing is in one building, traveling outside during the summer heat is atrocious, and your supervisors will be a little annoying with the jobs they ask you to do

job_title: Peer Leader/Student Worker in Ferguson, MO
pros: Flexible hours, location, and working/learning at the same location. Direct networking with faculty and staff throughout the Florissant Valley Campus and St. Louis Community College as a whole.
cons: Living wages are higher than minimum wage but could use some improvement. Employees could benefit from more access to fitness facilities to aid in healthy lifestyle.

job_title: Senior Instructional Designer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Benefits are great and they pay well for being an educational institution
cons: When they want to get rid of people, they rename your job title/description and make you reapply to keep your job--unless you're the one they want to get rid of--then they just don't rehire you.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Florissant, MO
pros: None, except you'll feel better when you walk away.
cons: Treats adjunct professors and part time staff like slaves. Glass ceiling for promotion. Constant back stabbing and bullying by department chairs. Absolutely ZERO concern for their mission-Higher Education. Tons of red tape and no benefits for part time employees, not even sick days.

job_title: Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: STLCC makes an excellent impact in the community by offering a variety of degrees and certificates to be used for further education and/or academic growth.
cons: The only con is that people generally do not leave their positions but stay until retirement.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: They have great benefits.  It has a large umbrella of employees, so insurance has good pricing and good coverage
cons: A college struggling to stay relevant and get new students.  Therefore, the environment can be stressful and the compensation isn't great.

review_title: Great working environment, but limited opportunities for full-time employment
